707744f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 124th St.
707744f-a.text:
First avenue, east side, from 125th to 124th Streets, across
clearing.
Septembeg 19, 1934.
P.L. Sperr,Photogrepher.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707733f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 124th St.
707733f-a.text:
(1)
First Ave., south from, and including East 124th Street. as seeu
from the Manhattan Approach to the Tri Borough Bridge. Note the c o-
struction shack at the S.E. corner of 124th Street.
August 3, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO RTIPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the east side of First Ave., between 124th and 123rd
Streets. Also shown on the left, is the curved structual bedway of the
bridge approach from the East River Drive.
August 3, 1936.
T. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707738f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 124th St.
707738f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., east side, north from, but not including East 124th to
and including 125th Streets. Shown also is the Approach to the Willis
Ave. Bridge.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same.
September 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707740f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 124th St.
707740f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., north from and including East 124th., to and including
125th Strects, as seen across clearance for the Manhattan Approach to
the Tri-Borough Bridge. Also shown is East 124th Street, north side,
west from and including First, to and including Second Aves. On the
right, appears a rear view of East 126th Street, south side, west from,
but not including First Ave. Notice Second Ave., Elevated Line on
Second Ave.
September 17, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, as seen from East 125th Street. Note surface car and
Second Ave., Elavated station on said street.
September 17, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, showing a view further northward.
2:  September 17, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707735f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 124th St.
707735f-a.text:
(1)
First Avenue, west side, from 124th to 125th Streets, a view
north showing the Willis Avenue Bridge at the northern end of
First Avenue.
Demolition of some of these houses has already begun.
June 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same block, another view. All the houses except the two
at and adjoining the corner of 124th Street are being demolished
for the Triborough Bridge Plasa.
June 21, 1934.
P. 1  .. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, not showing the two houses left standing at the 124th
Street and of the block.
June 21, 1934.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715300f-a.title: Manhattan: 124th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
715300f-a.text:
(1)
East 124th Street, north side, east from Second, to and incltmding
First Aves. Note Second Ave. Elevated overhead.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPEODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same; from a different angle. Note demolition in progress on
the N.E. corner of Second Ave.
EJuy 1:. 1934.T
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707734f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 124th St.
707734f-b.text:
(1)
2416 and 2420 First Avenue, east side, at 124th Street.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, a closer view of the junk shop. The filling station
on the S.E. corner occupies the site of a one-story shop which
hhas been torn dowh1.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715299f-a.title: Manhattan: 124th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
715299f-a.text:
(1)
East 124th Street, west from.(No. 317), but not including First
Ave. Note Elevated Lines on Second and Third Aves., respective.
June 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same; from a point further eastward, and only showing the north side.
June 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707743f-a.text:
First Ave., west side, between East 124th and 125th Streets.
September 17, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
